inlineContent.text: Few things are as powerful as a personal invitation. A personal invitation says “I want YOU here” — not everybody but you in particular. It says “I find you valuable.”

If you want someone to show up, and if it is at all possible, send a personal invitation. Not a form letter or newsletter made up to seem personal. Not a Facebook event or Meetup with them on the guest list.
Send a handwritten note, pull the person to the side, or start a direct chat with them. Despite our modern technological age, the personal touch is still the real magic.

abstract.text: David Brunow, known as Brunow [ˈbɹunoʊ] to the folks he works with, is a human living on Earth. You might have something in common with him — if you think it is ridiculous that he is talking about himself in the first person here, so does he.
